CHAPTER.VERS: book of generation of Jesus Christ, son of David, son of Abraham.
Abraham begot Isaac; and Isaac begot Jacob; and Jacob begot Judas and his brethren;
and Judas begot Phares and Zara (of) Thamar; and Phares begot Esrom; and Esrom begot Aram;
and Aram begot Aminadab; and Aminadab begot Naasson; and Naasson begot Salmon;
and Salmon begot Booz (of) Rachab; and Booz begot Obed (of) Ruth; and Obed begot Jesse;
and Jesse begot David the king. And David the king begot Solomon (of) the of Urias;
and Solomon begot Roboam; and Roboam begot Abia; and Abia begot Asa;
and Asa begot Josaphat; and Josaphat begot Joram; and Joram begot Ozias;
and Ozias begot Joatham; and Joatham begot Achaz; and Achaz begot Ezekias;
and Ezekias begot Manasses; and Manasses begot Amon; and Amon begot Josias;
and Josias begot Jechonias and his brethren, (at) of the carrying away of Babylon.
And (after) the carrying away of Babylon, Jechonias begot Salathiel; and Salathiel begot Zorobabel;
and Zorobabel begot Abiud; and Abiud begot Eliakim; and Eliakim begot Azor;
and Azor begot Sadoc; and Sadoc begot Achim; and Achim begot Eliud;
and Eliud begot Eleazar, and Eleazar begot Matthan; and Matthan begot Jacob;
and Jacob begot Joseph the husband of Mary, (of) whom Jesus Who was being called Christ was born.

Therefore all the generations (from) Abraham (to) David fourteen generations; and (from) David (until) the carrying away of Babylon, fourteen generations; and (from) the carrying away of Babylon (to) the Christ, fourteen generations.«
Now the of Jesus Christ thus. For Mary his mother has been engaged to Joseph, (before) they came together she was found having (in) womb (of) Holy Spirit.
But Joseph her man, he was being righteous, and was not willing to expose her publicly, purposed she be put away secretly.

And he has pondered these things, behold, a messenger of the LORD appeared to him (in) a dream, saying, Joseph, a son of David, do not fear to take Mary your woman; for that which was begotten (in) her is (of) Holy Spirit.
And she will bring forth a son, and thou will call His name Jesus; for He Himself will save His people (from) their sins.
Now this came all to pass, in order that which was spoken (by) the LORD (through) the prophet may be fulfilled, saying,
behold, the virgin will have (in) womb and will bring forth a son, and they will call His name Emmanuel, which is being interpreted, God (with) us.
And Joseph have been aroused (from) the sleep, he did as the messenger of the LORD ordered him; and he took to his woman,
and he was knowing her not until she brought forth her firstborn son; and he called his name Jesus.«
Now Jesus has been born (in) Bethlehem of Judaea, (in) days of Herod the king, behold, (from) east (at) Jerusalem,

all Galilee, teaching (in) their assemblies, and proclaiming the glad tidings of the kingdom, and healing every disease and every bodily weakness (among) the people.

The ones who are mourning blessed; for they themselves will be comforted.
The meek blessed; for they themselves will inherit the earth.

The merciful blessed; for they themselves will find mercy.

The peacemaking blessed; for they themselves will be called sons of God.
The ones who have been persecuted (on account of) righteousness blessed; for the kingdom of the heavens is theirs.
Ye are blessed whenever they should reproach you and should persecute, and should say every wicked word (against) you lying, (on account of) Me.
Keep on rejoicing and exulting, for your reward great (in) the heavens; for thus they persecuted the prophets who (before) you.«

Ye yourselves are the salt of the earth: but if the salt should become tasteless, (with) what will it be salted? It is being good (for) nothing any longer, but to be throw out, and to be being trampled upon (by) men.
Ye yourselves are the light of the world; a city is being situated (on) a mountain is not being able to be hid;
nor they are lighting a lamp and are putting it (under) the corn measure, but (upon) the lampstand, and it is shining for all the ones who (in) the house.
Thus let your light shine (before) men, so that they may see of you the good works, and may glorify your Father Who (in) the heavens.«
Do not think that I came to abolish the law or the prophets: I came not to abolish, but to fulfill.
For verily I am saying to you, until the heaven and the earth will pass away, one iota or tittle shall in no wise pass away (from) the law, until all should come to pass.

Therefore whosoever should break one of these least commandments, and should teach men so, he will be called least (in) the kingdom of the heavens; but whosoever should practice and should teach , this will be called great (in) the kingdom of the heavens.
For I am saying to you, »Unless your righteousness should abound (above) of the scribes and Pharisees, ye shall in no wise enter (into) the kingdom of the heavens.«
Ye heard that it was said to the ancients, thou will not commit murder, but whoever should commit murder, he will be liable to the judgment.

But I Myself am saying to you, »Everyone who is being angry with his brother lightly will be liable to the judgment: but whoever should say to his brother, fool, he will be liable to the Sanhedrim: but whoever should say, stupid, he will be liable (to) the Gehenna of fire.«
Therefore if thou should be offering thy gift (at) the altar, and there thou should remember that thy brother is having something (against) thee,
leave there thy gift (before) the altar, and keep going away, be first reconciled to thy brother, and then keep coming keep offering thy gift.

Keep being agreeing with thy adverse party quickly, (until) while thou are (in) the way (with) him, lest the adverse party should deliver thee to the judge, and that judge should deliver thee to the officer, and thou will be throw (into) prison.
Verily I am saying to thee, thou shall in no wise come out thence, until thou should pay the last kodrantes.«
Ye heard that it was said, thou will not commit adultery:
but I Myself am saying to you, »Everyone who was looking upon a woman (to) lust after her, already committed adultery with her (in) his heart.«

But if thy right eye is causing to offend thee, pluck it out and throw (from) thee: for it is being profitable for thee in order that one of thy members may perish, and thy body may not be throw whole (into) Gehenna.

And if thy right hand is causing to offend thee, cut it off and throw (from) thee: for it is being profitable for thee in order that one of thy members may perish, and thy body may not be throw whole (into) Gehenna.
Also it was said, »Whoever should put away his woman, let him give to her a letter of divorce.«

But I Myself am saying to you, »Whoever should put away his woman, except of word fornication, is causing her to be committing adultery, and whoever should marry has been put away is committing adultery.«
Again, ye heard, that it was said to the ancients, thou will not break an oath, but thou will render to the LORD thy oaths;
but I Myself am saying to you swear not at all, neither (by) the heavens, because it is throne of God;
nor (by) the earth, because it is footstool of His feet: nor (by) Jerusalem, because it is city of the great King;
neither do not swear (by) thy head, because thou are not being able to make one hair white or black.
But keep letting your word be, yea yea, nay nay: but which more than these is (from) evil.«
Ye heard that it was said, eye (for) eye, and tooth (for) tooth;
but I Myself am saying to you resist not evil; but whosoever will strike thee (on) thy right cheek, turn to him also the other;
and to the one who was willing to go to law with thee and to take thy tunic, yield to him also cloak;
and whosoever will compel thee to go one mile, keep going (with) him two.
Keep giving to the one who is asking of thee; and turn not away from the one who was wishing to borrow (from) thee.«
Ye heard that it was said, thou will love thy neighbor and will hate thy enemy;

but I Myself am saying to you, keep loving your enemies, keep blessing the ones who are cursing you, and keep praying (for) the ones who are despitefully using you and are persecuting you; keep doing well to the ones who are hating you,
so that ye may be sons of your Father Who (in) the heavens: »He is causing His sun to rise (on) evil and good, and is sending rain (on) just and unjust.
For if ye should love the ones who were loving you, what reward are ye having? Are not also the tax gatherers doing the same? Yes!
And if ye should salute your friends only, what extraordinary are ye doing? Are not also the tax gatherers doing so? Yes!
Therefore ye yourselves will be perfect, even as your Father Who (in) the heavens is perfect.«
Keep taking heed your alms are not performing (before) men, (to) be seen by them: otherwise ye are not having a reward (with) your Father Who (in) the heavens.

Therefore whenever thou should be doing alms, do not sound a trumpet (before) thee, as the pretenders are doing (in) the assemblies and (in) the streets, so that they may have glory (from) men; verily I am saying to you, they are having their reward.
But thou are doing alms, let not thy left hand know what thy right hand is doing,
so that thy alms might be (in) secret: and thy Father Who is seeing (in) secret Himself will render to thee (in) the open.«

And whenever thou should be praying, thou will not be as the pretenders , for they are loving to be praying having had stood (in) the assemblies and (in) the corners of the streets, so that they may possibility appear to men; verily I am saying to you, »They are having their reward.«

But thou, whenever thou should be praying, enter (into) thy chamber, and thou have shut thy door, pray to thy Father Who (in) secret; and thy Father Who was seeing (in) secret will render to thee (in) the open.
But ye were praying do not use vain repetitions, as the heathens : for they are thinking that they will be heard (in) their much speaking.
Therefore be not like unto them: for your Father knows of what things ye are having need (before) ye asked Him.«
Therefore keep praying yourselves thus: our Father Who (in) the heavens, let Thy name be sanctified;
let Thy kingdom come; let Thy will be done as (in) heaven, and (upon) the earth;
give to us today our needed bread;
and forgive to us our debts, as also we ourselves are forgiving our debtors;
and do not lead us (into) temptation, but deliver us (from) the evil one. For the kingdom and the power and the glory is Thine (to) the ages. Amen.
For if ye should forgive to men their offences, your Heavenly Father will also forgive to you;
but if ye should not forgive to men their offences, neither your Father will forgive your offences .«

And whenever ye should be fasting, stop being as the pretenders downthrow in countenance; for they are disfiguring their faces, so that they may appear fasting to men; verily I am saying to you, »they are having their reward.«
But thou, thou were fasting, anoint thy head, and wash thy face;
so that thou may not appear fasting to men, but to your Father Who (in) secret; and your Father Who will be seeing (in) secret will render to you.«
Stop treasuring up for yourselves treasures (upon) the earth, where moth and rust is spoiling, and where thieves are digging through and are stealing:
but keep treasuring for yourselves treasures (in) heaven, where neither moth nor rust is spoiling, and where thieves are not digging through nor are stealing.
For where your treasure is, there your heart will be also.
The lamp of the body is the eye: therefore if thine eye should be single, thy whole body will be light;
but if thine eye should be evil, thy whole body will be dark. Therefore if the light which (in) thee is darkness, how great that darkness?

No one is being able to be serving two Lords; for either he will hate the one, and will love the other; or he will hold to one, and will despise the other. Ye are being not able to be serving God and mammon.«

(Because of) this I am saying to you, stop being careful as to your life, what ye should eat and what ye should drink; nor as to your body, what ye should put on. Is not the life more than the food and the body than the raiment? Yes!

Look (at) the birds of the heaven, that they are not sowing, nor are reaping, nor are gathering (into) granaries, and your heavenly Father is feeding them: are ye yourselves not much better than they? Yes!
But who (out of) you being careful is being able to add (to) his stature one cubit?
And why are ye being careful (about) raiment? Observe the lilies of the field, how they are growing: they are not laboring nor are spinning;
but I am saying to you, »not even Solomon (in) all his glory was clothed as one of these .«
But if God is thus arraying the grass of the field, is today and is being throw tomorrow (into) an oven, He not much rather you, O of little faith? Yes!
Therefore do not be careful, saying, what shall we eat, or what shall we drink, or with what shall we be clothed?
For the nations are seeking after all these things; for your heavenly Father knows that ye are having need of all these things;
but keep seeking first the kingdom of God and His righteousness, and all these things will be added to you.
Therefore be not careful (for) the morrow: for the morrow will be careful about the of itself: the evil of it sufficient to the day.«
Stop judging, in order ye may not be judged:
for (with) what judgment ye are judging, ye will be judged; and (with) what measure ye are measuring, it will be measured to you.
But why are thou looking on the mote which (in) the eye of your brother, but are thou perceiving not the beam (in) your eye? Yes!

Give not the which holy to the dogs; nor throw your pearls (before) the swine, lest they should trample upon them (with) their feet, and should have turned again should rend you.«
Keep asking, and it will be given to you; keep seeking, and ye will find; keep knocking, and it will be opened to you.
For everyone who is asking is receiving, and the one who is seeking is finding, and it will be opened to the one who is knocking.
Or what man is there (among) you, whom if his son should ask bread, will he give to him a stone? No!
And if he should ask a fish, will he give to him a serpent? No!
Therefore if ye yourselves are being evil know to be giving good gifts to your children, how much more your Father Who (in) the heavens will give good things to the ones who are asking Him?«
Therefore if ye should be desiring all whatever things in order that the men might be doing to you, so also yourselves keep doing to them: for this is the law and the prophets.
Enter in (through) the narrow gate; for the gate wide and the way which is leading (to) destruction broad, and there are many who are entering (through) it:
how the gate is narrow and the way which is leading (to) life straight, and there are few who are finding it.«
But keep giving heed (of) the false prophets, who are coming (to) you (in) raiment of sheep, but within they are rapacious wolves.
Ye will know them (by) their fruits; are they gathering a bunch of grapes (from) thorns, or figs (from) thistles? No!

A good tree is not being able to be producing evil fruits, nor a corrupt tree to be producing good fruits.
Every tree is not producing good fruit is being cut down and is being throw (into) fire.
Then surely ye will know them fully (by) their fruits.«
Not everyone who is saying to Me, LORD, LORD, will enter (into) the kingdom of the heavens; but the one who is doing the will of My Father Who (in) heavens .

And then I will confess to them, »I never knew you: keep departing (from) Me, the ones who are working lawlessness.«
Therefore everyone whosoever is hearing these words of mine, and is doing them, I will liken him to a prudent man, who built his house (upon) the rock:
